intro: Mentzelia gypsophila, commonly known as the gypsum lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils, often found in desert or arid environments. It has a short growing season and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important species in its native habitat.
